website_summaries.verdict: The Moto E4 is the cheapest Motorola phone but doesn't compromise too much on its amenities.
pros: The Moto E4 has a near stock version of Android Nougat, a fingerprint reader, a removeable battery, a selfie flash and is splash resistant -- all while being ridiculously cheap
cons: The display is hard to see in sunlight and the camera is slow to process photos

customer_reviews.title: The phone is not "unlocked" - it is "Verizon" branded phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is advertised as "unlocked". However, it is actually a "Verizon" branded phone and does not work on the T-Mobile network. When I submitted the return request, I found out that I have to pay for return shipping. Return shipping should be free because the product is not as "advertised".
customer_reviews.author: Radio Head

customer_reviews.title: My E4, she loved it
customer_reviews.text: Earlier in the year, bought my wife a Moto G Play, she loved it. I bought the Moto E4, she loved it. I now have the Moto Play and she has the E4. The E4 is faster and seemingly a little easier to use. The fingerprint scanner works great. Now I can't use her cell phone. Put in her T-Mobile sim and installed a 64 mb micro sd card and it worked right off the bat. Synched her apps, phone directory, photos, and docs stuff on Google Chrome and she was off and running.
customer_reviews.author: Masao Miwa

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!!! Verizon phone Not the correct ...
customer_reviews.text: Warning!!!! Verizon phone Not the correct description. It said it was an UNLOCKED unit, and it's not. This is a Verizon phone. Also the box was opened.
customer_reviews.author: DHH

customer_reviews.title: I liked the fact that it was unlocked and worked on ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on Sprint. I liked the fact that it was unlocked and worked on all US carriers. (Verizon rejects it since they use a international version of the phone with some differences. But, who wants Verizon if you are buying a cheap phone anyway?). Replaceable battery, back pops off to exposes sim, SD and battery. Doesn't look cheap at all. I bought two and both work out of box. I didn't go with the Amazon ad version so that may be responsible for some of the problems that some complain about. Great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: San Antonio Sam

customer_reviews.title: SIM reader failure on 2 different phones
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd read and he'd more reviews here. The first one of these we bought lasted just over a month before it stopped recognizing the SIM card. There is nothing we could do to restore it. Thinking it a fluke, we bought another... it lasted one week. These phones have a software issue so that if they range out of service area for too long, they stop recognizing SIM cards. Otherwise, they are nice little phones. But with the error, they can't call or send or receive texts.
customer_reviews.author: Sellis

customer_reviews.title: Good phone. Bad camera
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a cheap phone to do the basics, this is the one. Came from an LG V10. You can tell it's definitely isn't as good, an extra second loading an app or searching Google maps mainly. But considering the hundreds of dollars difference between the 2 phones, it's a fair trade. Really the only thing that is sub par is the camera. I'm not a camera guy and I could tell right away.
customer_reviews.author: Nich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Budget Phone
customer_reviews.text: Tired of spending too much on other phones so I decided I wanted something inexpensive I could use in Hawaii and the Philippines. I also found how easy it was to remove the back and replace sim cards. Battery time is great, recharges quickly and enough apps for me. Didn't get all worked up when phone got a little rain on it and glass didn't crack when dropped. Camera still not iPhone quality, but for the price and features this is a great phone. I even used it as an iPod type device in Malaysia without a sim card, relying only on wifi, Skype and other apps. New Zealand is next. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: DBHawaii

customer_reviews.title: Sound stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Moto until today. I only had this phone for 19 months when suddenly the internal and external microphones stopped working. I could receive and place calls, but the phone would not ring and I was unable to hear the ther Party (but oddly they could hear me clearly). Navigation apps worked but audio directions did not function. Very disappointed in the lack of longevity of this product. Everything else works great, but I’m in trouble if I need to call 911 for an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Great phone Great price
customer_reviews.text: With phones like this that aren't too far off from these high priced phones but still VERY compatible why go the expensive route?? Only thing I should have done was go for the plus model for only a few dollars more but I didn't know it came in a plus which is even closer to all these top dollar phones!! Never would I spend over 600$ with great phones like this around
customer_reviews.author: Michael Borges

customer_reviews.title: An ideal middle-road phone
customer_reviews.text: It's not blazing fast, but it doesn't suffer from random app crashes like really cheap phones do. The camera is not as good as the "plus" version, but still fairly good. The battery is also much smaller than the E4 Plus, but still a bit bigger than average. It's also one of the better phones you can get if you don't want something absurdly large.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating this 5 stars because it looks great, the screen is great, it works very well for a $129 phone. My daughters have had very few, if any, problems with it. The only thing to consider is that if the rest of the family has iphones and you're using the Moto strictly for wifi, you have to use a new app for texting - Google hangouts or a social media platform. Not having imessage is a major bummer, but it would be that way with any Android phone. I would say this is a great device for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Same as someone else. I ordered a new unlocked ...
customer_reviews.text: Same as someone else. I ordered a new unlocked phone. I got a used Verizon phone. Right model but big problem for me as I'm about to leave on a trip to the UK where I will not be able to use this phone!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C.

customer_reviews.title: CELLPHONE IS GREAT, BUT DEDICATED SPRINT "ONLY" PHONE!
customer_reviews.text: Motorola makes great cellphone and I have NO COMPLAINTS about the phone, but SPRINT uses dedicated frequencies so this phone cannot be used with T-Mobile, Verizon or any other carrier. I wished I had known that before I bought it for my T-Mobile cell cerivice. I returned the phone with the UPS Shipping Labels from Amazon and I trust we won't have any troubles with the full refund. Thank you for reading my review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Not unlocked, tied to Verizon
customer_reviews.text: Phone was advertised as unlocked, phone arrived as a Verizon phone. Invoice said Verizon phone. I am planning on using it on ATT. What's next?
customer_reviews.author: C. Gilboy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I searched for the Moto e4 Plus and then after purchasing it, turns out it was only the Moto e4. Only give one star because it wasn't what I ordered and not to mention I had to call my provider and order a SIM card so that's another 5 days without the phone being used. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: This a great phone (for me at least) for the cost. The fingerprint reader works most of the time. Not all the time, that is why I have it 4 stars. And the battery lasts a day with normal usage. I am not a person who is always attached to my phone. If I was this phone wouldn't work. But for me it works. It lasts a day so that is why I have it 3 stars. It would be nice if it lasted at least 2 days before having to recharge it.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell L. Gowen

customer_reviews.title: Received a used Verizon locked phone instead of new/unlocked.
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a new unlocked phone but what I received was a used Verizon pre-paid phone which I will be returning shortly. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McLain

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone to upgrade from an 8gb (memory) so I could use more apps. I am using the phone on Page plus, and everything works fine. The phone is fast, has all the features I want, and is a good size (not too big nor small for me). I would recommend it to anyone who want good service without overpaying. Had it about 3 months with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: aneesh

customer_reviews.title: Overall we're VERY happy with both of the ones we bought
customer_reviews.text: Overall we're VERY happy with both of the ones we bought. We are far from power uses and do not check FB, watch video or play games. Basically use it for voice calls, texting, email and GPS when traveling. We try to keep the charge between 20% and 85%, and end-up charging about every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Ron O

customer_reviews.title: Terrific phone for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I've never been one to blow $600-$1000 on a phone... which is why I have money in the bank. :-) It's a phone, people! This one works great both here and abroad (used it in Italy and Canada so far, no problemo). I'm not using it as a top-of-the-line camera; I have a Sony SLR for that. But it takes decent enough shots in most circumstances. Only complaint is I'd like more storage - 16GB gets full real fast. So I'm choosy about downloading apps.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Wannabe

customer_reviews.title: We like it - a lot.  First smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is our first 'smart phone' so we are hardly experts in the field. But we are happy with our phones (although still learning how to use them!!). We add some slip on covers to protect them a bit and add a bit of bulk and ease of holding. They certainly seem very responsive with good screen graphics. Finger print sensor system seems to work well as does the camera. Battery life is great. The only other thing we may add is microSD card for extra memory. We also like the fact that our version is unlocked and capable of operating on multiple systems.
customer_reviews.author: BobM

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't connect to Verizon
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a very nice phone. Liked the fingerprint id a lot. Took it to Verizon store, they said they couldn't connect it to their service. Went home printed out the "answers" section about work around's for connecting to Verizon. Took it back to Verizon store, they read them and said that wasn't possible to do. Regrettably sent back phone as I wanted Verizon as a carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Fleischer

customer_reviews.title: Best budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Best phone for the money. Single finger print navigation button is the best. Good first phone for a kid or basic phone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: The description says unlocked. When I took it to ...
customer_reviews.text: The description says unlocked. When I took it to Verizon to have it added to my plan they said it was a prepaid phone and could not add it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Attix

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Really liked it until the forced update. Now phone calls hang up at random followed by fulI loss of all audio. Reminders, Notifications, audible feedback. Everything. Works again after reboot/factory refresh, but then comes back again. Motorola keeps replacing it or just says it's a software problem from some app.....but problem persists. It's a hardware problem triggered by the update. Many complaints on web about it. Will not be using Motorola again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone I put Gcam on it and take better pictures love the manual controls on original camera app this is the first phone I've owned with a fingerprint scanner and it great 720p/60 is good for me headphones jack I'm glad is there the radio comes in great even in airplane mode nice slim design I have a case on it occasionally I take the case off to admire the design battery gets me through the day overall I recommend this it's the right size only gripe is storage size but we have SD card
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso M DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working, Motorola Tech Support Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Within three weeks the phone and data functions stopped working. The only thing that worked was WiFi so the phone stopped being a phone. Hours on the phone with tech support/Motorola revealed only that further analysis needed to be done by other specialists. Sim card works fine in other phones. Wasted money on this Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Really makes you appreciate how overpriced and unnecessary Flagship phones are
customer_reviews.text: Really makes you appreciate how overpriced and unnecessary Flagship phones are. Camera is nothing like an iPhone 7S of course but more than good enough for most use cases. The screen is great audio is just as good as the Pixel I had. Solid construction for such a lightweight phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: For under a hundred bucks this is a brilliant phone. Excellent screen quality, fast and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money, if you like commercials.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes this phone. The only complaint I have is that it has a ton of commercials no matter what network or Carrier you have it has constant advertisements that you cannot control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cellphone antenna dies after 1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: Cellphone is ok. Nothing great about it really other than it works. I am seriously disappointed that the cel. antenna died one year after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: tj

customer_reviews.title: it is working just fine and it is being used
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely buy again. However, it said in the product information that it would come with original accessories and it did not. Other than that, it is working just fine and it is being used, so far, in Central America with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Susana Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this phone...tho it replaced the first one that died after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Loved this phone when we first bought it. But that one failed after a few months and we got a replacement. This one has worked great for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Tiffany, author of Youth In Asia, a Vietnam War novella

customer_reviews.title: Unique phone
customer_reviews.text: Its fingerprint reader replaces beautifully the navigation buttons, a pocket friendly 5" screen size allows to use it one-handed and the battery lasts all day. The camera is not so good so get the slightly larger 5.2" Moto G5 Plus if you need a better camera, although none of them have NFC for Android Pay unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My purchase was suppose to be a NEW phone but with all the problems IT COULDN'T BE
customer_reviews.text: This phone was purchased as a gift and there are problems cannot retrieve text messages phone doesn’t always ring when called and I call this phone very often and when it doesn’t ring it doesn’t show a missed call BUT when I call this phone it rings on my end gives voice message but on the receiving end there is nothing and sometimes it takes recalling two or three times before the phone actually ring
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great phone but doesnt work with Sprint
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone but it doesnt work with Sprint or their MVNOs. I checked the MEID online through sprint, tello, twigby, boost and went into a boost store who called in tech support to see if it could work and they said no after researching a bit. I tried it on mint, unreal and pageplus and it worked. mint mobile on tmobile was kinda slow download speeds of .15 Mbs (not a typo) but probably has nothing to do with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: my02cents

customer_reviews.title: but it is really pretty slick overall
customer_reviews.text: This is no iPhone, but it is really pretty slick overall. I got the unlocked no-ad version, and I've had no problems with it so far. You might want to get a case for it since the camera assembly sticks out partway from the back. I've never had it freeze up, and I was able to activate a prepaid nano SIM card with it until I could get on a new plan. Comes with very little bloatware, seems very close to pure Android.
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is nice. Easy to use. No adds. Talk, text, gps and google look ups are easy. Screen resolution is good. I'm glad I chose this phone. Battery is good to. I use this phone everyday, during work, and it hasn't failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got a prepaid Verizon phone.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone as a spare for the two of these I had already purchased in July, 2018. Fast forward to September, 2019 and I need to use it as one of the others got a cracked screen. Low and behold, it turns out to be a Verizon prepaid phone that Verizon would be happy to unlock for $75. I never left a review until now as I was never angry enough to leave one before.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: Flash stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but shortly after buying it the flash stopped working. Now there is no flash for pics or flashlight 🔦.
customer_reviews.author: T-cee

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Sprint!
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with a sim card, had to physically go to my carrier's store to purchase that. Once I purchased the sim card, turns out that it's not compatible with Sprint, after all. Will be returning!
customer_reviews.author: Wen

customer_reviews.title: phone died
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my father in law who uses it for Waze and phone calls only, the phone stopped working after three months.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Flo

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, just make sure you get edge-to-edge tempord glass and a good case!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second E4 I've had. The first was carrier locked Verizon version I got at Walmart new for $49.95. This new one I purchased is a refurbished but carrier unlocked and I got for $59. Excellent phone, great support from Motorola, excellent over all speed and quality. The seller here was quick and of accurate description. This is a arefurb but I can't tell! New quality in my eyes!
customer_reviews.author: De Zel Mint

customer_reviews.title: Great price, usually works but currently has a very ...
customer_reviews.text: After owning this phone for just a couple weeks it began periodically restarting itself. At least once a day this happens for no apparent reason. Fyi, I installed all updates, did not root the phone or install non Google play apps. Great price, usually works but currently has a very annoying flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rock

customer_reviews.title: Good for the phone and bad for charging
customer_reviews.text: Good phone, just great for the money paid for the E4. But the battery life Span is too short and takes an average of 4.5 hrs to charge full. Too long, but dies of within 2.5 hrs if used non stop.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Kpadeuwa

customer_reviews.title: Liked it but had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. First one had poor audio quality out of the box (bought from another vendor) and this one would not connect to t-mobile after a week. Sorry Moto no more for me!
customer_reviews.author: BillVN

customer_reviews.title: Was great until it started randomly resetting itself
customer_reviews.text: I used this phone for a year with no problems and absolutely loved it. About a year later, it would start randomly resetting itself as if I just bought it, wiping out my apps, my contacts, EVERYTHING. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamilah A.

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive phone I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: I hate spending more than $200 on phones but also hate the fact that cheap phones are very unreliable. As soon as I started using this phone, I loved it. It has very good internal memory and RAM and has very up to date software. It runs smoothly and has many accessories available to buy separately. Overall, you definitely get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value Choice
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a solid new Android phone under $150, this is likely the best buy out there. Perfect for those that are not tech enthusiasts but non the less want a modern smart phone. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: M James

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad phone it works good with my total Wireless SIM card could have better camera though
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: good phone little different from galaxy I am used too
customer_reviews.text: good phone little different from galaxy I am used too. But good picture and sound. Great phone for the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not the same
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the same one I had. bought earlier (also a 4th gen.) but this is different and not nearly as good. Also does not fit the same glass screen protector or carring case.not pleased but need the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality...ordered a replacement and the second one was just as bad. I really wanted to like this phone but cannot for the life of me figure out why the second one just never turned back on after 2 weeks use.
customer_reviews.author: AvidHerbalist

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean looking phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought the E4 for my daughter as her old phone was about dead and I didn’t want to pay AT&T any more money than I have to so far she says it works great
customer_reviews.author: 8 SEC.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive wonderful cellphone
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful smart phone. Runs on TracFone with No problems. Memory card is great and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J's VW

customer_reviews.title: One of the best phones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price, if all you need is something basic this will easy get you through the day with little to no issues
customer_reviews.author: Austin L.

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: i have bought this phone in January 2018, now it is February 2019, and phone does not ring any more , just makes low vibration sounds, that can be heard only 1 foot away. Can not use it any more, have to look for a new one. Do not recommend to buy.
customer_reviews.author: alla flaska

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. Purchased as a gift for a friend. Don't expect iPhone, Google Pixel, or Samsung Galaxy S8 quality and performance. This is a budget phone but a solid performer with a near stock Android experience. It's the only sub $150 smartphone I would ever recommend. The $99 Prime version with ads is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Spector

customer_reviews.title: stuck with "restricted access changed voice service blocked" the phone was fine until two days ago
customer_reviews.text: my phone is suddenly locked. stuck with "restricted access changed voice service blocked" the phone was fine until two days ago. how on earth do i fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone except the power button after 3 days ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone except the power button after 3 days gets a little mushy (which I was told that was a normal gripe from alot of youtube reviewers) but outside of that its a really nice phone!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Uber work phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price! Huge battery, surprisingly light, decent resolution for size, snappy enough processor (compared to cheap $50-$60 Alcatels I've had), I use it for Uber and it's been good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Tochtli Ochtli

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great phone especially for the price. It is definitely what I hoped for and more.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Band

customer_reviews.title: No problems with Verizon
customer_reviews.text: Product works well. It is awesome to have an inexpensive phone with the latest version of the OS and little to no bloat. I was able to activate with Verizon with no issues at all. I simply walked in and they knew exactly what to do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Device has Amazon adware
customer_reviews.text: Buyers should be aware that this device has embedded Amazon apps that are not removable. This should have been noted in the product description. I specifically did not want an Amazon marketing phone.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamen Wetherill

customer_reviews.title: Like others are reporting, it's not what was advertised
customer_reviews.text: I got a Mexican phone (literally) and the box and instructions were in Spanish. It refused to work on Ting, as the IMEI was rejected. Returning because it won't activate on a US cellular network.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Woodring

customer_reviews.title: Not My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: If you like the power button beneath the volume buttons, this is the phone for you. It is challenging to close screens, check messages, and use the back swipe. I've had the phone a short time and the voicemail messages will not clear. I love Motorola, but this is by far my least favorite phone.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonKay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I sent this phone to venezuela and it’s working great with Movistar
customer_reviews.author: Norka

customer_reviews.title: Great charger..recharges fast! Wish my tablets were this quick!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot figure out the voicemail..the code I put in tells Me it's invalid.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Henning

customer_reviews.title: Good phone.
customer_reviews.text: Good phone with great battery life. Moto gestures are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sriram Sethumadhavan

customer_reviews.title: LOVEEEEEEEEEE
customer_reviews.text: This phone is very good, comes with the latest update of Android and being almost Android pure, as is customary in Motorola, is very good, is the first time I write a review but it is because I really fall in love with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, great price. We have Verizon, it synched up all on it's own as soon as she signed into google.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good basic smart phone with all the bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.text: A very good value on a phone that does everything expected. Even has a very reasonable battery life ( five days for me).
customer_reviews.author: Christine S Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Very nice phone.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. It was an upgrade for my Samsung Galaxy S3. Very fast and nice screen.
customer_reviews.author: rw80227

customer_reviews.title: worked great for two months
customer_reviews.text: worked great for two months... then the wireless network connection stopped working. Now i get to spend my holidays trying to see if it is under warranty...dealing with amazon, Motorola, and t-mobile. This sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Boscolo

customer_reviews.title: use with ATT prepay
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7th grader to use on the ATT prepaid. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: BecsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awsome value
customer_reviews.text: Great phone.love it.just as fast and user friendly as any high dollar phone I've had.so glad I picked this phone.has fingerprint unlock and the sound quality is pretty good also.best phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D.Bumann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. The phones arrived on time. Quality of product is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13yo teenage girl and she loves it. Great price no worries if she breaks it
customer_reviews.author: jonp

customer_reviews.title: phone is junk
customer_reviews.text: phone did not last six months I would like a replacement if possible......Bill
customer_reviews.author: William R Towe

customer_reviews.title: Died after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Initially we loved this phone, but touch screen completely unresponsive after 8 months, then it just died after that. No amount of support could bring it back.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Falls

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, but...
customer_reviews.text: ... it stopped working after 12 months. That is I could not make any calls or send text. A T-Mobile tech could not get it back working either. So probably not worth the money as it is always a lot of work to reconfigure a new phone
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Becker

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I need.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best camera, but battery lasts a long time and it's cheap. Definitely buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Cory Sessums

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my phone
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this phone. I like the larger font compared to my old phone. I would buy this phone again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey W

customer_reviews.title: Verizon will not use it.
customer_reviews.text: Is everything it claimed to be, except Verizon refused to enable it. I went with a different carrier, less expensive, without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy G. Klugewicz

customer_reviews.title: broke after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in November and it broke in June.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Reference card
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive a card with the phone. Verizon wanted $20.00 to transfer all of the old phone numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Dowd

customer_reviews.title: and it is a great value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and it is a great value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Sim slot problem!
customer_reviews.text: I, like a lot of other reviewers am having the problem where the Sim card is not recognized by the phone. I've purchased 3 of these phones and use the same Carrier with all of them. Switched out SIM cards so I know the problem isn't the card. Only this phone is having the issue.... so far. I'm just over the month return period for Amazon. Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: JRB23

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great so far. Device has been fast and responsive for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ketch

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooo  Disappointed :(  :(  :(
customer_reviews.text: I was initially pleased with the phone's screen resolution and battery life and equally displeased with it's inability to maintain the carrier's signal inside buildings. However what earned it a two rating overall is that something is going on with the sounds of the phone. It started with my incoming calls not ringing and then progressed to my alarms not ringing. No amount of restarts/resets have corrected this issue. I have done everything but a restore to factory settings with this phone. Needless to say, I am shopping for another phone and will not be looking at the Moto brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sea  Peay

customer_reviews.title: Great budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Great budget phone. Does what u need it to do without all the bells and whistles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality phone for the price. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hauder

customer_reviews.title: Slim, light weight phone. Works great with T-mobile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my grandmother and she is delighted.
customer_reviews.author: FullyRenewed

customer_reviews.title: SIM card reader suddenly NOT working within 7 wks of purchasing; in vain to reset
customer_reviews.text: SIM card reader suddenly not working last week (after only 7 weeks of purchasing and operating). I brought it to T-Mobile, and they verified the SIM card works. They even reset the phone back to factory setting, however, it was in vain. Cannot even find a way to contact the seller. No seller email or phone number appears at my order history. I have two other moto e4, and so far they work fine. It's just this one. It's a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Moto's E is for Excellent - -  Budget Phone.
customer_reviews.text: Reality is, this is a great budget phone. Android is stable, charges a a decent speed. Best part? User replaceable and Swappable Battery. I get at least 1 day of moderate usage on a full charge - but not a power user or game player. Screen is bright for regular use, and sound is fairly decent. Bluetooth works awesome, and headphone port provides enough juice to listen to tunes or videos online, or my favorite items off my plex.tv server. Wireless is more than suitable for 99.9% of users. Only missing item I can tell is NFC support. But let's not expect miracles for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy Butler

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: refurbished item advertised as new
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this item wasn't advertised as Verizon Wireless but as unlocked non-carrier phone. It was actually a prepaid version tied to Verizon. In top of that, the box seal was broken. Open box item must be sell as REFURBISHED not as NEW. I wouldn't use an pre-owned or seal-broken smart phone to keep my personal and financial information. It is too risky. I wonder how many hacked phones are out there stealing information from people. Just saying
customer_reviews.author: Luis E Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice cam... Great Good looking cel phone.. Was a gift to my daughter and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Millan Lunar Carlos Andres

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: First smart phone, still learning it, very sensitive, you really have to watch what your finger touches.
customer_reviews.author: Al Longworth

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is good phone only problem is the memory is small
customer_reviews.author: Shae-Marie S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Picture is good. Fast download and quick charge time. Good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Dickey

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto E (4th Gen.) XT1764 16GB Unlocked GSM LTE Android Phone w/ 8MP Camera - Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe new Moto E features a vibrant 5” HD screen designed to fit right in your hand. With its water-repellent coating, spills, splashes, or a little rain won’t get in your way. It takes beautiful sharp photos and selfies even in low light, with the 8 MP rear camera or the 5 MP selfie cam with an LED flash. It unlocks with your fingerprint. Moto E. Everything’s just right.
feature_bullets: Fast 4G LTE speed, 1.4 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 quad-core processor, 2 GB RAM with 16 GB internal memory and support for up to 128 GB microSD card
Brilliant 5” HD display with water-repellent screen
6 MP front-facing camera and 8 MP rear-facing camera with flash
Fingerprint sensor that unlocks the phone; Massive battery: Up to 2 days on a single charge, plus rapid charging when it’s time to refuel
Enjoy the best of Android 7.1 Nougat with split screen view, Google Play Store, Google Maps, Gmail, and Google Assistant for hands-free voice commands
Compatible with AT&T & T-Mobile. Will NOT work with CDMA networks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars430 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
